rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral language describing status/uncertainty/observation ('hasn't made the changes', 'unclear whether it ever will', 'been a student of').
The segment reports on the virus not making changes and uncertainty about the future.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports absence of changes (bare positive fact) and uncertainty without explicit calming language.
No minimiser or scale contrast found.
'hasn't made the changes' and 'unclear whether it ever will' are bare negations without explicit calming cue.
